solution_line_template: There is an equal number of clownfish and blowfish, which means there are {total_fish} fish / {equal_parts} = <<{total_fish}/{equal_parts}={initial_blowfish}>>{initial_blowfish} blowfish.

Since some stay in their tanks, there are {initial_blowfish} blowfish - {blowfish_staying_in_own_tank} blowfish = <<{initial_blowfish}-{blowfish_staying_in_own_tank}={blowfish_in_display_tank}>>{blowfish_in_display_tank} blowfish in the display tank.

There were the same amount of clownfish until {blowfish_in_display_tank} clownfish / {clownfish_return_divisor} = <<{blowfish_in_display_tank}/{clownfish_return_divisor}={clownfish_swam_back}>>{clownfish_swam_back} clownfish swam back to their own tank.

This leaves {blowfish_in_display_tank} clownfish - {clownfish_swam_back} clownfish = <<{blowfish_in_display_tank}-{clownfish_swam_back}={clownfish_in_display_tank_final}>>{clownfish_in_display_tank_final} clownfish in the display tank.
